skill.description: Use this skill when creating comprehensive testing strategies for applications. Provides test planning templates, coverage targets, test case structures, and guidance for unit, integration, E2E, and performance testing. Ensures robust quality assurance across the development lifecycle.

skill.author: AI Agent Hub

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files, code examples, and templates. No executable scripts, no network calls, no file system access beyond its own resources, and no environment variable access. Contains only testing guidance and best practices.

content.value_statement: Creating effective testing strategies is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill provides ready-to-use templates, coverage checklists, and proven patterns for unit, integration, E2E, and performance testing. It helps teams establish quality gates and ensure robust test coverage across all development phases.
actual_capabilities: Generate test plans with risk-based testing priorities and coverage targets
Create test case templates with Given-When-Then structure and validation checkpoints
Apply the Testing Trophy model for balanced test distribution
Configure quality gates for CI/CD pipelines with coverage thresholds
Design test data strategies using factories and fixtures
Identify coverage gaps using comprehensive checklists
limitations: Does not execute tests or generate test code automatically
Does not install or configure testing tools on your system
Does not integrate with specific CI/CD platforms beyond general guidance
Does not provide project-specific test recommendations without context

use_cases.title: Create test plans
use_cases.description: Develop comprehensive test plans with templates covering unit, integration, and E2E testing phases.

use_cases.title: Set up CI quality gates
use_cases.description: Configure automated testing pipelines with coverage thresholds and quality gates for continuous integration.

use_cases.title: Improve test coverage
use_cases.description: Identify gaps in existing test coverage and apply best practices for writing maintainable tests.

prompt_templates.title: New project testing
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new feature or project
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a testing strategy for our new [language/framework] [application type]. Include coverage targets, recommended tools, and a test plan outline.

prompt_templates.title: Coverage analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Review our current test setup and suggest how to improve coverage for [module/component]. What tests are missing and what patterns should we use?

prompt_templates.title: CI/CD integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a CI/CD pipeline with quality gates for our [JavaScript/Python] project. Include linting, unit tests, integration tests, and coverage reporting.

prompt_templates.title: E2E test design
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a complete E2E test plan for the [user journey] in our application using Playwright. Include test data setup and validation checkpoints.

output_examples.input: Create a testing strategy for our new React e-commerce checkout flow
output: Testing Trophy Distribution: 70% integration, 20% unit, 10% E2E
Coverage Targets: 80% overall, 95% for payment/auth paths
Risk Priority: Critical (100%): Payment processing, Authentication
Risk Priority: High (90%): Cart operations, Order creation
Quality Gate: Block merge if coverage < 80% or any tests fail

best_practices: Follow the Testing Trophy model with most tests at integration level
Use Given-When-Then pattern for clear, focused test cases
Establish quality gates in CI/CD before merging code
Test critical paths (payment, auth, data mutations) at 100% coverage
anti_patterns: Testing implementation details instead of user-visible behavior
Creating giant test cases that cover multiple workflows
Writing flaky tests with non-deterministic timing or shared state
Using 100% coverage as the sole indicator of test quality

faq.question: What testing frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports JavaScript/TypeScript (Jest, Vitest, Playwright, k6) and Python (pytest, Locust). Can guide you to select tools based on your project framework.

faq.question: What coverage targets should I aim for?
faq.answer: Recommended: 80% overall, 95-100% for critical paths (payment, auth), 90% for business logic, 70% for UI components.

faq.question: How do I integrate testing into CI/CD?
faq.answer: The skill provides YAML pipeline examples with stages for linting, type checking, unit tests, coverage reporting, and E2E tests with quality gates.

faq.question: Does this skill write or run tests?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidance, templates, and patterns. You write and execute tests using your chosen testing framework.

faq.question: How do I handle external API testing?
faq.answer: Use mocking for external APIs in unit tests and sandbox/test environments for integration tests. The skill provides detailed mocking examples.

faq.question: How is this different from code-review-playbook?
faq.answer: Testing Strategy Builder focuses on test planning and coverage. Code Review Playbook guides code review processes and quality standards.
